page.title: 17Farming,Trefriw and Maenan.
page.content: Farming in this area shows considerable diversity as a result of variations of soil and altitude. The uplands above Trefriw provide random summer grazing for sheep which are brought down to lower levels for the winter season, following ancient practice. The valley fields are also used for beef cattle and silage, though some fields are prone to flooding, especially when heavy rain fall over 24 hrs coincides with high spring tides.An embankment has been constructed in an attempt to control flooding. The more fertile Maenan area has mixed farming, of sheep and cattle,together with some potato and vegetable crops. Some farmers augment their income providing a service for caravanners.
